gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Water Wells for Monitoring Ground Water: Indiana, 2008

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Department of Natural Resources (IDNR), Division of Water (Data compiler)
Center for Geospatial Data Analysis (CGDA) (Data compiler)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This point shapefile was created to display in a geographic information systems (GIS) environment the data points that represent the locations of ground-water monitoring locations in Indiana.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: OBSERVATION_WELLS_USGS_IN was developed as a tool for displaying the Indiana observation (monitoring) well network in a GIS environment. The data set includes records for wells that are currently active and inactive. Ground-water levels in aquifers throughout the state are used in conjunction with climate and soil-moisture data to monitor drought severity in Indiana.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS shapefile format, Microsoft Windows XP, approximately 164 Kb

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The attribute table provides URL links to United States Geological Survey (USGS) Web pages for individual monitoring wells in Indiana. The links provide additional station information and access to water-level measurements collected in the monitoring-well network. The U.S. Geological Survey, in cooperation with the Indiana Department of Natural Resources has collected ground-water data in Indiana since 1935. Today, the state observation well network consists of 37 active wells located throughout the state. Nine of these observation wells have been selected for monitoring, one in each climate division, to represent the general ground-water condition throughout the state. The IDNR, Division of Water analysis can be accessed through their Web site: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 2008, Status of ground water levels: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water Web site, <http://www.in.gov/dnr/water/7138.htm>, date accessed, September 4, 2008. Data from all 37 observation wells are collected in the field periodically by USGS personnel, checked for accuracy, and entered into a computerized database. The data are then downloaded by IDNR, Division of Water, graphed and analyzed. A primary purpose of monitoring ground-water levels in the state is to monitor drought severity. Additional information on drought severity can be obtained through the following IDNR Web sites: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 2008, Climatic onditions: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water Web site, <http://www.in.gov/dnr/water/7150.htm>, date accessed, September 4, 2008. Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 2008, Review of available drought indices: Indiana Department of Natural Resources Web site, <http://www.in.gov/dnr/files/ws-drought_indices_2008.pdf>, date accessed, September 4, 2008. Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 2008, Palmer drought severity index: Indiana Department of Natural Resources Web site, <http://www.in.gov/dnr/files/wa-PDSI_state.pdf>, date accessed, September 4, 2008.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Checks for duplicates (unique values in unique records) were performed on this data set. No checks on topology were performed on this data set.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Checks for duplicates (unique values in unique records) were performed on this data set. No checks on topology were performed on this data set.
This data set includes records for 91 active (37) and inactive (54) ground-water observation (monitoring) wells in Indiana, as of 2008.

The ESRI ArcMap point shapefile and Microsoft Excel spreadsheet from which the data were generated were provided by personnel of the IDNR, Division of Water. Many of the attributes in the shapefile attribute table were created by IDNR, Division of Water staff. The accuracy of these attributes was not evaluated. Some clarifications and changes were made for consistency, and obvious typographical errors were corrected to produce OBSERVATION_WELLS_USGS_IN. The following is from the "NWISWeb" site: United States Geological Survey, 2008, USGS Ground-water data for the nation: National Water Information System Web site, <http://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis/gw>, date accessed, September 4, 2008. "Real-time data are time-series (recorded at fixed intervals) data from automated equipment and represent the most current hydrologic conditions. Measurements are commonly recorded at 5-60 minute intervals and transmitted to the NWIS database every 1-4 hours. Real-time data are available online for 31 days. "Daily values are summarized from time-series data for each day for the period of record and may represent the daily mean, median, maximum, minimum, and/or other derived value. Daily values include approved, quality-assured data that may be published, and more recent provisional data, whose accuracy has not been verified. "Manual measurements of depth to water in wells. These measurements are often used to supplement and (or) verify the accuracy of the instantaneous measurements."

Accuracy is no better than that of the source material used to compile OBSERVATION_WELLS_USGS_IN.SHP. The method of location of the observation wells is unknown; and therefore the positional accuracy is unknown. However, the accuracy is assumed to be at least that of the high-quality points in WATERWELLS_IDNR_IN: Water-Well Locations in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Point Shapefile), which is at a scale of 1:24,000, or about 100 feet on the ground.
Vertical accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of the data set. No quantitative tests were performed.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The wells_90.shp shapefile was loaded into ESRI ArcMap for editing. The following fields were deleted, ID, 1988_DROUG, MONTHLY_RE, _EASTING_U, NORTHING_U, RANKING, and 2004_activ. The following fields were retained in OBSERVATION_WELLS_USGS_IN but renamed, CLIMATIC_D (now, CLIM_DIV), _AQUIFER_S, (now, AQ_SYS), ARTESIAN, (now, CONFINED), NEAR_SIGNI (now, NEAR_SWWF), WELL_NO__1 (now, WELL_NO), REF_NUMBER (now, IDNR_REF). The following fields were added and populated, SITEID, STN_INFO, STATUS2008, AQ_TYPE, and URL_Link. The file was projected from UTM Zone 16 NAD27 to UTM Zone 16 NAD83.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Geological Survey, Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: wells_90.shp, wells.xls, USGS observation well station information and downloadable water-level data (NWIS)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Geological Survey, Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This data set was used as the basis for updating the field "STATUS2008" in OBSERVATION_WELLS_USGS_IN to denote observation wells active in Indiana during 2008.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: wells.xls: list of observation (monitoring) wells active in 2008; this file is an informal working copy of a spreadsheet, not a published product.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
